example.english: The actor was angry when he found out he'd been replaced.
example.spanish: El actor estaba enojado cuando se enteró de que lo habían reemplazado.

example.english: She was angry that he hadn't called her back yet.
example.spanish: Ella estaba enfadada de que él aún no le había devuelto la llamada.

example.english: I'm very excited about going back to Spain.
example.spanish: Estoy muy emocionado por regresar a España.

example.english: The children were very excited to see Santa.
example.spanish: Los niños estaban muy entusiasmados por ver a Papá Noel.

example.english: This TV presenter has quite an attractive voice.
example.spanish: Este presentador tiene una voz atractiva.

example.english: The advertising campaign of this brand is very attractive.
example.spanish: La campaña publicitaria de esta marca es muy atrayente.

example.english: La guerra es una experiencia horrible.
example.spanish: War is a horrible experience.

example.english: El terremoto del 2010 fue horrible.
example.spanish: The 2010 earthquake was horrific.

example.english: I am usually awake before the alarm goes off.
example.spanish: Suelo estar despierto antes de que suene el despertador.

example.english: That dog's barks awoke the whole neighborhood.
example.spanish: Los ladridos del perro despertaron a todo el vecindario.

example.english: She was asleep on the couch for three hours.
example.spanish: Estuvo dormida en el sofá tres horas.

example.english: I was sitting in a weird position and now my foot is asleep.
example.spanish: Estaba sentando en una postura rara y ahora tengo la pierna adormecida.

example.english: This poet always writes about beautiful things.
example.spanish: Este poeta suele escribir sobre las cosas hermosas.

example.english: He took her to watch the beautiful sunset.
example.spanish: La llevó a mirar el atardecer bello.

example.english: He went through an ugly phase in high school.
example.spanish: Pasó una etapa de ser feo en el colegio.

example.english: They faced an ugly defeat at the Battle of Manassas.
example.spanish: Enfrentaron una derrota desagradable en la batalla de Manassas.

example.english: We'll need a bigger house when the baby is born.
example.spanish: Necesitaremos una casa más grande cuando nazca el bebé.

example.english: Maggie loves to sit under a big tree and read a novel.
example.spanish: A Maggie le encanta sentarse debajo de un gran árbol y leer una novela.

example.english: I have lived in a very small house for many years.
example.spanish: He vivido en una casa muy pequeña por muchos años.

example.english: He's eight, but he looks small for his age.
example.spanish: Tiene ocho años, pero se ve chico para su edad.

example.english: Coffee tastes very bitter without sugar.
example.spanish: Sin azúcar el café está muy amargo.

example.english: Marge is a bitter woman at odds with the world.
example.spanish: Marge es una mujer resentida peleada con el mundo.

example.english: We will serve a sweet wine with the dessert.
example.spanish: Serviremos un vino dulce con el postre.

example.english: It was good to hear the sweet sound of her voice again.
example.spanish: Estuvo bien volver a oír el dulce sonido de su voz.

example.english: There was a sense of calm in the living room.
example.spanish: Había una sensación de calma en la sala.

example.english: I usually go to the lake for peace and calm.
example.spanish: Suelo ir al lago para paz y tranquilidad.

example.english: They say that actors always get nervous before coming on stage.
example.spanish: Se dice que los actores siempre se ponen nerviosos antes de salir a escena.

example.english: You're making me nervous!
example.spanish: ¡Me estás poniendo nerviosa!

example.english: I'm so chubby I don't fit in my dress anymore.
example.spanish: Estoy tan rechoncha que ya no me sirve el vestido.

example.english: The baby always puts his chubby fingers in his food.
example.spanish: El bebé siempre mete sus dedos regordetes en la comida.

example.english: He's tall, slim, and handsome.
example.spanish: Es alto, delgado y guapo.

example.english: She has a very slim waist.
example.spanish: Tiene la cintura muy fina.

example.english: I usually clean my house on Saturday.
example.spanish: Suelo limpiar la casa los sábados.

example.english: You should clean the fruit before eating it.
example.spanish: Deberías lavar la fruta antes de comerla.

example.english: Their hands were dirty after playing in the mud.
example.spanish: Tenían las manos sucias después de jugar en el barro.

example.english: I don't want your dirty money.
example.spanish: No quiero tu dinero sucio.

example.english: This food is cold. Send it back to the kitchen.
example.spanish: Esta comida está fría. Devuélvela a la cocina.

example.english: She is such a cold person. She didn't acknowledge me at all when I greeted her.
example.spanish: Ella es una persona tan fría. No me devolvió el saludo.

example.english: The tray came out of the oven very hot.
example.spanish: La bandeja salió del horno muy caliente.

example.english: We're going to the pool to enjoy the hot weather.
example.spanish: Vamos a la piscina para disfrutar de las temperaturas cálidas.

example.english: This food is cold. Send it back to the kitchen.
example.spanish: Esta comida está fría. Devuélvela a la cocina.

example.english: She is such a cold person. She didn't acknowledge me at all when I greeted her.
example.spanish: Ella es una persona tan fría. No me devolvió el saludo.

example.english: When the nights are warm, we sleep without sheets.
example.spanish: Cuando las noches están cálidas, dormimos sin sábanas.

example.english: How are your hands warm? Mine are freezing.
example.spanish: ¿Cómo es posible que tengas las manos calientes? Las mías están congeladas.

example.english: That's correct. Lions are carnivores.
example.spanish: Eso es correcto. Los leones son carnívoros.

example.english: Excuse me, I don't think you gave me the correct change. I gave you a five.
example.spanish: Disculpe, creo que no me dio la vuelta exacta. Le he dado cinco.

example.english: It seems my calculations were incorrect and I got the wrong answer.
example.spanish: Parece que mis cálculos fueron incorrectos y obtuve un resultado equivocado.

example.english: We had an incorrect address and got lost.
example.spanish: Teníamos la dirección errónea y nos perdimos.

example.english: I found a dead roach behind the sofa.
example.spanish: Encontré una cucaracha muerta detrás del sofá.

example.english: I'm dead after today's workout.
example.spanish: Estoy muerto después del entrenamiento de hoy.

example.english: I didn't know whether he was dead or alive.
example.spanish: No sabía si estaba muerto o vivo.

example.english: A romantic date is perfect to keep the flame of passion alive.
example.spanish: Una cita romántica es perfecta para mantener viva la llama de la pasión.

example.english: She dug a deep hole in the sand with her shovel and pail.
example.spanish: Ella cavó un hoyo profundo en la arena con su pala y cubo.

example.english: You need a very deep pot to cook all of that soup.
example.spanish: Necesitas una olla muy honda para cocinar toda esa sopa.

example.english: Their mother ordered them to stay in the shallow end of the pool.
example.spanish: Su mamá les mandó que se quedaran en el lado poco profundo de la piscina.

example.english: She gives her cat food in a shallow dish.
example.spanish: Le da comida a su gato en un plato llano.

example.english: The exam was so easy the entire class finished in 15 minutes.
example.spanish: El examen fue tan fácil que la clase entera terminó en 15 minutos.

example.english: He moved to Costa Rica to live the easy life.
example.spanish: Se mudó a Costa Rica para vivir la vida cómoda.

example.english: This math exercise is too difficult for me.
example.spanish: Este problema de matemática es muy difícil para mí.

example.english: It's a difficult situation when neither party is wrong.
example.spanish: Es una situación complicada cuando ninguno de los lados está mal.

example.english: I wish that bag wasn't so expensive.
example.spanish: Ojalá ese bolso no fuera tan caro.

example.english: I can't go on the trip; the tickets are too expensive.
example.spanish: No puedo ir en el viaje, los boletos son demasiado costosos.

example.english: The store had a clearance sale and everything was really cheap.
example.spanish: La tienda estaba de liquidación y tenía todo muy barato.

example.english: It's sometimes cheaper to fly than drive.
example.spanish: A veces resulta más económico ir en avión que en coche.

example.english: The restaurant needs to find extroverted people to work as waiters.
example.spanish: El restaurante necesita encontrar personas extrovertidas para trabajar como meseros.

example.english: My sister is very shy; she never talks in class.
example.spanish: Mi hermana es muy tímida; nunca habla en clase.

example.english: Don't be so shy. Nobody will make fun of you.
example.spanish: No seas tan penoso. Nadie se va a burlar de ti.

example.english: How far is it to Mexico City?
example.spanish: ¿Qué tan lejos estamos de la Ciudad de México?

example.english: Grandpa's birthday is not far.
example.spanish: El cumpleaños del abuelo no está lejos.

example.english: Are we near? I'm really tired.
example.spanish: ¿Estamos cerca? Estoy cansadísima.

example.english: The day of the interview was getting nearer.
example.spanish: Se acercaba el día de la entrevista.

example.english: We took a fast train to the airport.
example.spanish: Tomamos un tren rápido al aeropuerto.

example.english: Marina got a fast car for her birthday.
example.spanish: Marina recibió un coche veloz para su cumpleaños.

example.english: We kept a slow pace so we could enjoy the surroundings.
example.spanish: Íbamos a paso lento para disfrutar de los alrededores.

example.english: The traffic is slow on route 18.
example.spanish: El tráfico va despacio en la ruta 18.

example.english: It really isn't polite to call people fat.
example.spanish: Es de mala educación llamar gorda a la gente.

example.english: I've been carrying around these fat books all day and my back hurts.
example.spanish: He estado llevando estos libros gruesos el día entero y me duele la espalda.

example.english: You look thin now that you've started exercising more.
example.spanish: Te ves delgado desde que empezaste a hacer más ejercicio.

example.english: She's as thin as a rake.
example.spanish: Está flaca como un palillo.

example.english: The tank was full when we started our trip.
example.spanish: El depósito estaba lleno cuando empezamos el viaje.

example.english: The theater was far from full.
example.spanish: El cine no estaba ni mucho menos lleno.

example.english: We have to go shopping; the fridge is empty.
example.spanish: Tenemos que hacer compra; la nevera está vacía.

example.english: During the summer, the school is empty.
example.spanish: En el verano, la escuela está desocupada.

example.english: He is so funny; he makes me laugh all the time.
example.spanish: Es muy gracioso; siempre me hace reír.

example.english: I don't know what you're laughing at. I don't find it funny when someone falls down.
example.spanish: No sé de qué te ríes. A mí que alguien se caiga no me parece divertido.

example.english: She's the most boring person I know.
example.spanish: Es la persona más aburrida que conozco.

example.english: The book you lent me was really boring.
example.spanish: El libro que me prestaste estuvo muy aburridor.

example.english: Look at all those presents. Santa Claus has been very generous this year!
example.spanish: Mira todos esos regalos. ¡Papá Noel ha sido muy generoso este año!

example.english: I gave the waiter a generous tip.
example.spanish: Le di al camarero una generosa propina.

example.english: She's so selfish, she doesn't care about anyone else but herself.
example.spanish: Es tan egoísta que se preocupa única y exclusivamente de sí misma.

example.english: A good man always helps those in need.
example.spanish: Un buen hombre siempre ayuda a los necesitados.

example.english: This is a good sign of economic growth.
example.spanish: Esta es una buena señal de crecimiento económico.

example.english: I can't believe I wasted my time on such a bad movie!
example.spanish: ¡No puedo creer que perdí mi tiempo viendo una película tan mala!

example.english: I've read it a second time and still think that it's a bad book, even if very entertaining.
example.spanish: Lo he leído por segunda vez y sigo pensando que es un mal libro, aunque muy entretenido.

example.english: I'm feeling happy because I'm going to Cancun next week.
example.spanish: Me siento feliz porque la semana que viene voy a Cancún.

example.english: We painted our walls yellow, and I'm really happy with the result.
example.spanish: Pintamos las paredes de amarillo y estoy muy contento con el resultado.

example.english: I felt very sad when he left.
example.spanish: Me sentí muy triste cuando se marchó.

example.english: It was a sad mistake to buy this house.
example.spanish: Fue un error lamentable comprar esta casa.

example.english: The lake was hard as a rock after a week of freezing temperatures.
example.spanish: El lago estaba duro como una roca después de una semana de temperaturas heladas.

example.english: I couldn't sleep because the mattress was hard.
example.spanish: No pude dormir porque estaba duro el colchón.

example.english: My new cashmere blanket is so soft.
example.spanish: Mi nueva manta de cachemir es tan suave.

example.english: I have a bad back and I prefer soft mattresses.
example.spanish: Tengo la espalda mala y prefiero los colchones blandos.

example.english: That box is heavy. Lift with your legs!
example.spanish: Esa caja está pesada. ¡Usa tus piernas para levantarla!

example.english: Traffic was heavy in the morning.
example.spanish: La circulación de coches era densa por la mañana.

example.english: We danced by the light of the moon.
example.spanish: Bailamos a la luz de la luna.

example.english: Could you turn on the light, please?
example.spanish: ¿Podría encender la luz, por favor?

example.english: We hiked to the top of a high mountain to get a better view of the valley.
example.spanish: Caminamos hasta la cima de una montaña alta para tener una mejor vista del valle.

example.english: The airplane lost cabin pressure while flying at a high altitude.
example.spanish: La cabina del avión se despresurizó mientras volaba a gran altura.

example.english: The children's books are on a low shelf.
example.spanish: Los libros infantiles están en una repisa baja.

example.english: We received a very low amount of applications this year.
example.spanish: Recibimos una cantidad muy baja de solicitudes este año.

example.english: There is no reason to drive such a huge car if you're usually by yourself.
example.spanish: No hay ninguna razón de conducir un coche tan enorme si normalmente estás solo.

example.english: Your arms look huge! Have you been lifting weights?
example.spanish: ¡Tus brazos se ven inmensos! ¿Has estado levantando pesas?

example.english: Remember when it was cool to have a tiny cell phone?
example.spanish: ¿Recuerdas cuando estaba de moda tener un móvil minúsculo?

example.english: The tiny mosquito can do a great deal of harm.
example.spanish: El diminuto zancudo puede causar una gran cantidad de daño.

example.english: It is very kind of you to help me with my chores.
example.spanish: Es muy amable de tu parte ayudarme con mis tareas.

example.english: The staff of the hotel was very kind, constantly asking us if we needed anything.
example.spanish: El personal del hotel era muy atento y nos preguntaba constantemente si necesitábamos algo.

example.english: There was an unpleasant smell coming from the basement.
example.spanish: Un olor desagradable emanaba del sótano.

example.english: I don't like him at all. I find him to be an extremely unpleasant person.
example.spanish: Me cae muy mal. Me parece una persona extremadamente desagradable.

example.english: We danced by the light of the moon.
example.spanish: Bailamos a la luz de la luna.

example.english: Could you turn on the light, please?
example.spanish: ¿Podría encender la luz, por favor?

example.english: In Alaska it gets dark very early in the winter.
example.spanish: En Alaska se pone oscuro temprano en el invierno.

example.english: My favorite colors are dark blue and light blue.
example.spanish: Mis colores favoritos son el azul oscuro y el azul claro.

example.english: We have a long way to go before we get home.
example.spanish: Tenemos un camino largo por delante para llegar a casa.

example.english: The landing strip is a mile long.
example.spanish: La pista de aterrizaje mide una milla de largo.

example.english: I think these pants are too short.
example.spanish: Creo que este pantalón es demasiado corto.

example.english: He was short for his age.
example.spanish: Era bajo para su edad.

example.english: New fall fashion trends debuted at New York Fashion Week.
example.spanish: Las nuevas tendencias de moda para el otoño debutaron en la Semana de la Moda en Nueva York.

example.english: My brother bought himself a new bike.
example.spanish: Mi hermano se compró una bici nueva.

example.english: My old printer still works really well.
example.spanish: Mi vieja impresora sigue funcionando estupendamente.

example.english: I will be fifty years old tomorrow.
example.spanish: Mañana cumpliré cincuenta años.

example.english: There is an open container in the fridge.
example.spanish: Hay un contenedor abierto en la nevera.

example.english: The pieces are handy to reach when the game board is open for play.
example.spanish: Las fichas se pueden alcanzar fácilmente cuando el tablero está abierto para jugar.

example.english: If the door is closed, knock before going in.
example.spanish: Si la puerta está cerrada, llama antes de entrar.

example.english: The side lanes are going to be closed all month.
example.spanish: Los laterales van a estar cerrados todo el mes.

example.english: A polite lady always says "Thank you." - Yes, Grandma.
example.spanish: Una señorita educada siempre da las gracias. - Sí, abuelita.

example.english: Your children are so polite!
example.spanish: ¡Tus hijos son muy educados!

example.english: The man at the counter was very rude.
example.spanish: El hombre del mostrador fue muy maleducado.

example.english: Laura made some rude remarks about my weight.
example.spanish: Laura hizo unos comentarios groseros sobre mi peso.

example.english: Use precise words to avoid ambiguity and confusion.
example.spanish: Usa palabras precisas para evitar la ambigüedad y la confusión.

example.english: I don't know exactly what you mean. Can you be more precise?
example.spanish: No sé exactamente qué quieres decir. ¿Puedes ser más concreto?

example.english: I prefer to go to work early, because the office is quiet.
example.spanish: Prefiero entrar al trabajo temprano porque la oficina está silenciosa.

example.english: He has become a quiet man since his wife's death.
example.spanish: Se ha convertido en un hombre callado desde la muerte de su esposa.

example.english: My heart is restless without her near me.
example.spanish: Mi corazón está inquieto sin su presencia.

example.english: Shelly looked out at the restless sea that seemed to reflect how she was feeling.
example.spanish: Shelly miró hacia el mar agitado que parecía reflejar su estado emocional.

example.english: His grandfather was rich and left him a trust fund.
example.spanish: Su abuelo era rico y le dejó un fondo fiduciario.

example.english: The furniture looked rich and unmistakably French.
example.spanish: El mobiliario era suntuoso e inconfundiblemente francés.

example.english: She grew up in a poor family in Alabama.
example.spanish: Se crió en Alabama en el seno de una familia pobre.

example.english: The poor girl had to walk for several hours in the snow.
example.spanish: La pobre niña tuvo que andar varias horas en la nieve.

example.english: Who has the right answer for the next question?
example.spanish: ¿Quién tiene la respuesta correcta de la siguiente pregunta?

example.english: Are you sure this is the right street?
example.spanish: ¿Estás seguro que esta es la calle?

example.english: You will see the school on the left.
example.spanish: Verás la escuela a la izquierda.

example.english: I have always said that that reporter's views are far to the left.
example.spanish: Siempre he dicho que las opiniones de ese periodista son muy de la izquierda.

example.english: Keep your passport in a safe place.
example.spanish: Guarda el pasaporte en un lugar seguro.

example.english: The children were rescued from the burning building and are safe now.
example.spanish: Los niños fueron rescatados del edificio en llamas y ya están a salvo.

example.english: It's dangerous to play with fire.
example.spanish: Es peligroso jugar con fuego.

example.english: Esta receta simple solo requiere tres ingredientes y cinco minutos para preparar.
example.spanish: This easy recipe only requires three ingredients and five minutes to prepare.

example.english: Los pusieron a hacer problemas simples de suma.
example.spanish: They had them do simple addition problems.

example.english: My health insurance plan is too complex even for me, and I'm a doctor.
example.spanish: Mi plan de seguro médico es demasiado complejo aún para mí, y soy médico.

example.english: It's too complex to explain in five minutes.
example.spanish: Es demasiado complicado para explicar en cinco minutos.
